completed_tasks.title: Review Strike 1: Ensure the project builds completely without errors with production-ready quality
completed_tasks.description:
Perform a comprehensive code review with focus on: Ensure the project builds completely without errors with production-ready quality

Check the entire codebase and ensure this criterion is met.

## CRITICAL FAILURE RESPONSE PROTOCOL

IF BUILD FAILS: Create specific tasks with appropriate categories to fix build issues:
- Missing dependencies installation tasks (category: 'build-error')
- Build configuration setup tasks (category: 'build-error')
- Compilation error resolution tasks (category: 'build-error')
- Environment setup tasks (category: 'missing-feature')
- Build script creation tasks (category: 'missing-feature')

CRITICAL: Use TaskManager API to add these tasks immediately when build failures are detected. All solutions must be production-ready, not simplified workarounds.

## SUCCESS CRITERIA
- Mark this review task as completed ONLY if the criterion is fully met
- If criterion fails, you MUST create remediation tasks using TaskManager API before marking review as completed
- All new tasks should be actionable, specific, and include proper dependencies/important_files parameters

## TASK CREATION REQUIREMENT
When creating remediation tasks, ensure each task includes:
- Clear success criteria
- Appropriate category (linter-error, build-error, missing-feature, bug, enhancement, etc.)
- Specific file dependencies
- Realistic time estimates
- High priority for critical issues
- Production-ready implementation requirements

Use the task-creation.md guidelines for optimal task structure.

completed_tasks.title: Set up rubocop configuration file and linting standards
completed_tasks.description: Create .rubocop.yml configuration file with appropriate Ruby style standards for Huginn project. Configure rubocop rules to enforce enterprise-grade code quality including frozen string literals, line length limits, method complexity, and documentation requirements.

completed_tasks.title: Fix auto-correctable Ruby style violations (1,892 issues)
completed_tasks.description: Run rubocop with auto-correct to fix the 1,892 autocorrectable style violations found in the codebase. This includes frozen string literals, string quote preferences, spacing issues, and basic formatting problems.

completed_tasks.title: Fix critical rubocop parsing errors (9 errors)
completed_tasks.description: Investigate and fix the 9 critical parsing errors reported by rubocop including Layout/IndentationWidth, Layout/FirstHashElementIndentation, Layout/ArrayAlignment, Layout/ArgumentAlignment, and Layout/MultilineOperationIndentation issues that are preventing proper linting analysis.
success_criteria: Rubocop can analyze entire codebase without errors

completed_tasks.title: Initialize project tasks from development directory
completed_tasks.description: Analyze all files in the development directory and create appropriate tasks based on their content. ALL CODE AND FEATURES MUST BE PRODUCTION-READY - NO SIMPLIFIED OR MOCK IMPLEMENTATIONS.
success_criteria: All files in development/ directory have been analyzed
Tasks created for implementing guidelines from development/general.md
Mode-specific tasks created based on development/modes/ files

Task list provides comprehensive coverage of project requirements
All created tasks have clear success criteria and appropriate priorities
All tasks follow production-ready mandate - no simplified implementations
completed_tasks.prompt:
Read and analyze all files in the development/ directory. Based on the content of these files, create a comprehensive set of tasks that will implement the guidelines, setup requirements, and development workflow described in the documentation. Focus on:

1. Development guidelines from general.md
2. Mode-specific requirements from modes/ directory
3. Project setup tasks based on README.md
4. Dependency and configuration tasks from package.json
5. Production-ready requirements from CLAUDE.md
6. Any other requirements found in development documentation

IMPORTANT: ALL CODE AND FEATURES MUST BE PRODUCTION-READY - NO SIMPLIFIED OR MOCK IMPLEMENTATIONS.

Create specific, actionable tasks with clear success criteria, appropriate categories (use TaskManager categories: linter-error, build-error, missing-feature, bug, enhancement, etc.), and proper dependencies. Ensure the task list provides complete coverage for setting up and developing the project according to the documented standards with enterprise-grade quality.

completed_tasks.title: Fix syntax errors in quality gates system blocking Rails environment
completed_tasks.description: Critical syntax errors in quality gates system files are preventing Rails environment from loading properly. Multiple files have Ruby syntax issues including: lib/quality_gates/notifier.rb (undefined NotificationChannels), lib/tasks/error_monitoring.rake (rescue modifier in hash), lib/performance_monitoring/regression_detector.rb (rescue in hash literal). These errors block Rails startup and development workflow.
success_criteria: All Ruby syntax errors resolved in quality gates files
Rails environment loads without syntax errors
Quality gates system files have valid Ruby syntax
All linter checks pass on modified files
No undefined constants or syntax errors in quality gates system
